article.title: Seismic measurement of the locations of the base of convection zone and helium ionization zone for stars in the {\it Kepler} seismic LEGACY sample

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the Hertzsprung-Russell diagram for the stars in the LEGACY sample. What does the color of the points represent?
choices: Age of the star
Mass of the star
Observed surface metallicity of the star
Acoustic depth of the base of the convection zone

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the results of fitting the observed oscillation frequencies using Method A for three different stars. What is the main difference in the helium signature between the low-mass star (KIC 8760414) and the other two stars?
choices: The acoustic depth of the helium signature is significantly different.
The phase of the helium signature is flipped by 180 degrees.
The amplitude of the helium signature is significantly smaller for the low-mass star.
There is no significant difference in the helium signature.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure showcases the results of fitting the second differences of the observed oscillation frequencies using Method B.  What do the histograms in the right panels represent?
choices: Distribution of acoustic depths for the CZ and He glitches from fitting multiple realizations of the data.
Distribution of the amplitudes of the CZ and He glitches for all stars in the LEGACY sample.
Distribution of frequencies for different l values for a single representative star.
Comparison of the acoustic depths obtained from Method A and Method B.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure compares the acoustic depths of the CZ and He glitches obtained using Method A and Method B. What conclusion can be drawn from the excellent agreement seen in the results of the two methods?
choices: Method A is always more accurate than Method B.
While the two methods show consistent results, this does not guarantee the accuracy of the individually determined depths.
The acoustic depth of the base of the convection zone is always accurately determined.
The acoustic depth of the helium ionization zone is systematically overestimated by both methods.

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula describes the function minimized in Method A to determine the best-fit parameters for the acoustic glitch signatures. What is the role of the second term (with the summation) in this function?
choices: It represents the standard chi-square value for the fit.
It accounts for the errors associated with the observed frequencies.
It acts as a regularization term to prevent overfitting of the smooth polynomial component.
It calculates the amplitude of the oscillatory signal from the base of the convection zone.
